articles.title: Kim Jong Un Inspects Pyongyang Children's Foodstuff Factory
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Inspects Pyongyang Children's Foodstuff Factory
 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK), first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army (KPA), gave field guidance to the Pyongyang Children's Foodstuff Factory.
					 Going round the mosaic depicting President Kim Il Sung and the monument to field guidance provided by leader Kim Jong Il in the compound of the factory, he recollected with deep emotion the undying feats Kim Jong Il performed by visiting it on July 8, 2001 with loving care.
					
					 He said in an excited tone that the world knew no such great fathers as Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il who regarded it as the most important affair of the party and state to love children, calling them kings of the country and devoting everything to them all their lives.
					
					 He proposed erecting new mosaic depicting the President and Kim Jong Il with profound reverence so as to convey down to posterity their love for the children and future. 
					
					 He went round the room dedicated to the history of the factory.
					
					 He recalled that the factory built under the care of the President turned into a comprehensive children's foodstuff production center for regularly producing and supplying foodstuff for babies in breast feeding and weaning periods such as powdered milk for babies, nutritious rice powder, varieties of powdered vegetables, powdered tangle and powdered fish, and soy-based milk and soy-based kefir good for the growth and development of children and pupils under the wise guidance of Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 He told the officials and employees of the factory to intensify the education through the immortal exploits performed by Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il for its development so that they may keep production going at a high rate and their love for the children may always reach them.
					
					 He went round the product show room, soy-based milk shop, nutritious rice powder shop, the shop for powdered milk for babies and other places of the factory to learn about in detail the production and management of the factory. 
					
					 He said the production should not be stopped at the factory even a moment because to put the production on a normal footing at the factory was not a simple economic and business matter but a matter concerning the sense of moral obligation towards Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Noting that the hostile forces are working hard to prevent the laughter of children from being heard, he underscored the need to boost the production of children's foodstuff so as to show them how the DPRK protects the children's happy life and defends socialism.
					
					 He gave an instruction to raise the quality of foodstuff to the highest level and develop new varieties of foodstuff for the growth of the children by comparing the foodstuff of the factory with the world famous infant's food and making an analysis of them with an ambition for holding world supremacy in foodstuff production.
					
					 He underlined the need to put all production processes on an automated, unmanned, germ-free and dust-free basis by learning from the foodstuff factories of the KPA which turned into model and standard of foodstuff factory in the country.  He called for perfectly updating the factory by the 70th founding anniversary of the WPK. 
					
					 He had a photo session with the officials and employees of the factory. 
					
					 Accompanying him were Choe Ryong Hae, secretary of the WPK Central Committee, KPA Vice Marshal Hwang Pyong So, director of the General Political Bureau of the KPA, An Jong Su and Han Kwang Sang, department directors of the C.C., the WPK, Ri Jae Il, first vice-department director of the C.C., the WPK, and Jo Yong Won, vice-department director of the C.C., the WPK.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets King of Bahrain
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets King of Bahrain
 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Tuesday sent a message of greeting to Hamad Bin Isa al-Khalifa, king of the Kingdom of Bahrain, on its national day.
					 The message expressed belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would grow stronger in the future, wishing the people of Bahrain steady progress and prosperity.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets President of Kazakhstan
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets President of Kazakhstan
 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Tuesday sent a message of greeting to Nursultan Nazarbayev, president of the Republic of Kazakhstan, on the occasion of its national day.
					 In the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the DPRK and Kazakhstan would grow stronger in conformity with the interests and desire common to the peoples of the two countries, the message wished the president and people of Kazakhstan success in their efforts to achieve the social unity and economic development.

articles.title: Ri Su Yong Congratulates to Mongolian FM
articles.content:
Ri Su Yong Congratulates to Mongolian FM
 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Ri Su Yong in a message on Monday congratulated Lundeg Purevsuren upon his appointment as foreign minister of Mongolia.
					 Expressing belief that the DPRK-Mongolia friendly and cooperative relations developing on good terms in recent years would grow stronger through close ties between the foreign ministries of the two countries, the message wished the Mongolian foreign minister success in his responsible work.

articles.title: Message from President of DR Congo
articles.content:
Message from President of DR Congo
 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, received a message from Joseph Kabila Kabange, president of the Democratic Republic of Congo, on Dec. 11 on the occasion of the third anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 The message extended Kim Jong Un and the Korean people boundless reverence of the president and people of the DR Congo for the eternal great state leader Kim Jong Il on the occasion of December 17, 2014, the national memorial day marking the third anniversary of his demise.
					
					 The message said that the Korean people have demonstrated the maturity and courage whereby they have steadily advanced the building of a thriving nation under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The president in the message wished Kim Jong Un big success in his work for the Korean people's happiness and progress, confirming his will to work with him to boost and develop the good friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries.

articles.title: Message from Nigerian President
articles.content:
Message from Nigerian President
 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, received a message from Goodluck Ebele Jonathan, president and commander-in-chief of the Armed Forces of the Federal Republic of Nigeria, on Nov. 7.
					 The president in the message expressed firm solidarity with Kim Jong Un and the good people of the DPRK on the occasion of the 3rd anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's demise on behalf of the government and people of the Federal Republic of Nigeria and on his own behalf.
					
					 The Nigerian people are looking back on the life of total dedication of Kim Jong Il who performed undying feats before the country and history through his energetic ideological and theoretical activities and revolutionary practices, the message said, adding:
					
					 Availing myself of this opportunity, I would like to express pleasure over the fact that the two countries have developed the bilateral relations on good terms and shared same views on issues of common concern in the international arenas in the past, and hope that such relations would as ever grow stronger onto a new higher stage in all fields.
					
					 The president paid highest tribute to Kim Jong Il on the occasion and hoped the contact and cooperation between the two peoples would grow stronger.
					
					 He reaffirmed invariable solidarity with Kim Jong Un and with all the Korean people on the occasion.

articles.title: Nigerian President Sends Floral Basket to Statues
articles.content:
Nigerian President Sends Floral Basket to Statues
 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- Goodluck Ebele Jonathan, president and commander-in-chief of the Armed Forces of Nigeria, sent a floral basket to the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill on the occasion of the third anniversary of Kim Jong Il's demise.
					 The floral basket was placed before the statues on Tuesday.

articles.title: Wreaths from Former S. Korean President's Widow, Chairwoman of Hyundai
articles.content:
Wreaths from Former S. Korean President's Widow, Chairwoman of Hyundai
 Kaesong, December 16 (KCNA) -- Ri Hui Ho, widow of former south Korean President Kim Dae Jung and president of the Kim Dae Jung Peace Center, and Hyon Jong Un, chairwoman of Hyundai Group, sent wreaths on the occasion of the third anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Wreaths were separately conveyed to Won Tong Yon, vice-chairman of the Korea Asia-Pacific Peace Committee, by Pak Ji Won, vice-president of the Kim Dae Jung Peace Center, and by Jo Kon Sik, president of Hyundai Asan Co. Ltd, in Kaesong on Tuesday.
					
					 Condolatory messages from Ri Hui Ho and Hyon Jong Un to Marshal Kim Jong Un on the occasion of the third anniversary of Kim Jong Il's demise were also conveyed. 
					
					 Kim Jong Un's thanks to Ri Hui Ho and Hyon Jong Un were courteously delivered by Won Tong Yon.

articles.title: Gifts from Nigerian Personage
articles.content:
Gifts from Nigerian Personage
 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un received gifts from Ahmad Rufai Sani, member of the Senate of Nigeria.
					 The gifts were handed to the DPRK ambassador to Nigeria on Dec. 12 by the member of the Senate.

articles.title: Floral Baskets to Statues from Foreign Political Parties
articles.content:
Floral Baskets to Statues from Foreign Political Parties
 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- Floral baskets were placed before the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill on Tuesday on the occasion of the third anniversary of demise of Kim Jong Il. 
					 They were sent by the National Executive Committee of the African National Congress of South Africa, the Central Committee of the Mozambique Liberation Front Party, the Nigeria-Korea Friendship Association, the Australia-DPRK Association for Friendship and Culture, the New Zealand-DPRK Society, the China Association for International Friendly Contact, the Association for Promotion of Development of Chinese Culture, the Liaoning Provincial Association for International Friendly Contact of China, Jilin Yuwen High School of China, the Japanese Women's Society for Solidarity with the Korean Women, the Association for Promotion of Friendship between Japan and North and South Korea and the Shigoku Liaison Council for Japan-Korea Friendship.
					
					 They were also sent by Giancarlo Elia Valori, chairman of the Italian General Investment Group, Kazuyoshi Hishiki, professor emeritus of Hiroshima Shudo University, Chizue Yamamura, representative of the Hyogo Prefectural Women's Council for Thinking about Korea's Issue in Japan, the family of former Prime Minister of Japan Sin Kanemaru and the family of Wilfred Burchett who was writer and journalist of Australia.

articles.title: Foreigners Pay Tribute to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Foreigners Pay Tribute to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- Members of the economic and commercial councilors corps, the Chinese embassy and the mission of the UNDP here and Chinese guests staying here visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill on Tuesday in the run-up to the third anniversary of demise of Kim Jong Il. 
					 They laid floral baskets before the statues and paid tribute to them.

articles.title: Service Personnel Visit Kumsusan Palace of Sun
articles.content:
Service Personnel Visit Kumsusan Palace of Sun
 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- Service personnel and people from all walks of life visited the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun to pay homage to President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Tuesday on the occasion of the third anniversary of demise of Kim Jong Il. 
					 They paid high tribute to the statues of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 At the hall where Kim Il Sung lies in state, service personnel and officials and other working people from provinces made bows to him.
					
					 They went round the hall where orders, medals and honorary titles he received from political and social figures of many countries of the world are on display. 
					
					 They entered the hall where Kim Jong Il lies in state and made bows to him. 
					
					 Going round the hall where orders he received are on display, the visitors hardened the belief that his revolutionary history and feats will always be alive in the hearts of the Korean people and other progressives of the world. 
					
					 They went round the halls which house cars, an electric car, a boat and train coaches used by Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il during their field guidance and foreign tours till the last moments of their lives.

articles.title: Oath-Taking Meeting of Officials and Members of DWUK Held
articles.content:
Oath-Taking Meeting of Officials and Members of Women's Union Held
 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- Officials and members of the Democratic Women's Union of Korea (DWUK) held a meeting at the Hall of Women on Tuesday on the occasion of the third anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il. 
					 At the meeting they renewed their pledge to hold him in high esteem for all ages and remain true to the leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 All participants observed a moment's silence in memory of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Kim Jong Sun, chairwoman of the C.C., DWUK, made a report to be followed by speeches.
					
					 The reporter and speakers said that for the past three years since the demise of Kim Jong Il, the greatest loss to the nation, all the service personnel and people have won victories in their struggle inspired by him, always remembering him, the great image of the great Paektusan nation.
					
					 They referred to the fact that he put the dignity and national power of Kim Il Sung's Korea on the highest level by leading the revolution and construction to victory for several decades and performed undying feats on behalf of the country, nation, times and history.
					
					 They said that history of the sacred Songun revolutionary leadership of the great Paektusan nation is given steady continuity and everything planned and desired by him is being translated into reality thanks to Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 They called for eternally holding Kim Jong Il in high esteem and making positive contributions to building a thriving nation, united close around Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Present there were Choe Ryong Hae, secretary of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, officials concerned and officials and members of the DWUK.

articles.title: Train Coach Reminiscent of Kim Jong Il's Great Feats
articles.content:
Train Coach Reminiscent of Kim Jong Il's Great Feats
 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- With the approach of the 3rd anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il (December 17, 2011), an endless stream of people visits the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun with humble reverence for him.
					 What catches visitors' eyes is a train coach Kim Jong Il used during his field guidance for the prosperity of the country and happiness of people.
					
					 Even in December Juche 100 (2011), he gave field guidance to South Hamgyong Province. Heavy snowfall, accompanied with icy-cold wind, was witnessed in the province on December 8. But Kim Jong Il spent that night on the running train and toured industrial establishments in Hamhung City on December 9-10, which have played a big role in improving the living standard of people.
					
					 He went on his train journey to give field guidance to different units in Jagang Province in the northern part of the country as wells as leading chemical factories in the eastern coastal area. 
					
					 He made 1 647 rounds of railway trips in his lifetime, covering more than 398,000 kilometers. During the trips, the train coach was his office and living room.
					
					 Now the people of the DPRK are recalling with deep emotion the great devotion made by Kim Jong Il for the well-being of people.

articles.title: New Varieties of Cosmos Bred in DPRK
articles.content:
New Varieties of Cosmos Bred in DPRK
 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- The Pyongyang Floriculture Institute of the DPRK is steadily increasing the variety of cosmos.
					 In recent years the institute has bred new varieties of cosmos different in flower color, like Seashells No. 1 and Sonata No.1.
					
					 They are very superior in peculiarities to the existing ones.
					
					 They come into bloom in late May, keeping their flowering period till the frost falls. Their flower is very bright in color and nearly twice than that of the existing ones in size.
					
					 Their plant is smaller than the existing ones in height. In particular, the height of Sonata cosmos is 40-60 centimeters.
					
					 An intensive research into cosmos began in July Juche 89 (2000) when the institute was founded under a far-reaching plan of leader Kim Jong Il. He instructed that species of beautiful flowers, different in color and with a long blooming duration, like cosmos should be cultivated and propagated across the country.
					
					 True to his instruction, scientists bred Sensation No. 1, a new variety of cosmos, for the first time in the country, which grows well in local climatic and soil conditions.
					
					 Kim Jong Il called on them to spread it throughout the country, indicating the orientation for future research.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Remembered by Whole World
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Remembered by Whole World
 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- Over the past three years since leader Kim Jong Il's demise more than 20 000 political and cultural events took place in over 190 countries and regions to praise his personality as the great man and his revolutionary feats and at least 70 000 foreign media gave publicity to his revolutionary career and history.
					 The Asia-Pacific Regional Committee for Supporting Peaceful Reunification of Korea called on the progressive bodies to form memorial committees and arrange memorial services to pay high tribute to him on the occasion of the first anniversary of his demise.
					
					 In hearty response to the call memorial committees having prominent personages as their chairpersons and co-chairpersons were formed at over 60 countries and international and regional bodies and since then they have conducted their activities in each continent, country and region.
					
					 All people expressed their fervent feelings to hold Kim Jong Il in high esteem.
					
					 The wax replica of Kim Jong Il depicting his image giving the service personnel and people of the DPRK his blessing, standing on the top of Mt. Paektu in simple jumper, was erected at the International Friendship Exhibition House.
					
					 The portraits of smiling Kim Jong Il were displayed at the Russia-DPRK friendship children joint classroom named after Kim Jong Il of Khabarovsk City Secondary School No. 11 of Russia, Kim Jong Il Class of "Gor King－Erdene" Institute of Teachers of Mongolia and Kim Jong Il Class of Progres School of Mali.
					
					 Those years witnessed the formation of the International Kim Jong Il Prize Council, the enactment and announcement of the International Kim Jong Il Prize, and the reorganization of the International Kim Il Sung Foundation into Kim Il Sung-Kim Jong Il Foundation.
					
					 A monument to Kim Jong Il Class was erected at primary school No. 2 in Kuwazana, Zimbabwe and recently a class of the Vietnam-DPRK Friendship Kindergarten was named after Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Kim Jong Il was presented with over 100 gifts by personages of different countries and international and regional bodies.
					
					 Immortal Kimjongilia has been widely cultivated and disseminated in different parts of the world.
					
					 Over 103,000 copies of Kim Jong Il's works were translated and published into more than 30 national languages by at least 270 political parties, bodies and institutions.
					
					 Newspapers, TV radios, magazines, bulletins and websites of different countries gave wide publicity to his brief biography, revolutionary career, feats and noble traits, accompanied with the portraits of smiling Kim Jong Il and his photos.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Ridicules S. Korean Forces' Foolish Daydream
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Ridicules S. Korean Forces' Foolish Daydream
 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- Shortly ago, the third meeting of the "Committee for Preparations for Unification" took place in Chongwadae. 
					 The south Korean chief executive present at the meeting ballyhooed about an important duty of the "Committee for Preparations for Unification" and the "human rights in the north." Then she even talked about "post-unification constitution."
					
					 At the instigation of the chief executive, the puppet group plans to map out a draft of the "charter for unification" within this year and hold a public hearing in the first half of the next year.
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday in a commentary brands the puppet forces' ruckus as a wanton challenge to the nation's desire for the reunification and a sinister artifice to escalate the confrontation with the compatriots as it is a clear revelation of the criminal scenario for achieving the unification of the social systems.
					
					 The "charter for unification" touted by the puppet forces is, in a nutshell, aimed to do harm to the social system in the north and realize the ambition for achieving the "unification under liberal democracy," the commentary says, adding:
					
					 It is unpardonable that the chief executive underlined the need to settle the issue of the "human rights in the north" without fail for the "future of unification."
					
					 Lurking behind her invective is a sinister aim of the puppet group to justify the anti-DPRK "human rights" campaign with rhetoric about "unification" and more frantically pursue it.
					
					 The Koreans will never overlook the puppet group's acts of challenging the north's proposal for achieving reunification by federal formula while crying out for the institution of the "charter for unification".
					
					 The "unification under liberal democracy" persistently sought by the south Korean puppet forces is no more than a foolish daydream that can never come true.
					
					 They are well advised to wait for stern judgment of the history and the nation, not for dreaming a pipedream becoming a laughing stock at home and abroad.

articles.title: Japan Accused of Trying to Keep Past Crimes Buried into Oblivion
articles.content:
Japan Accused of Trying to Keep Past Crimes Buried into Oblivion
 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- The Japanese reactionaries feign ignorance of the past crimes, far from making an apology to the international community and victimized countries for them. They are becoming vocal asserting that historical facts are wrongly understood by people and they should be corrected, and the parts dealing with Japan's crimes were deleted from domestic textbooks and a whirlwind is being kicked up to suppress Japanese conscientious media persons. 
					 Minju Joson Tuesday observes in a commentary in this regard:
					
					 This goes to prove that the Japanese reactionaries do not feel guilty conscience about the history woven with extra-large crimes against humanity and they have already been brutalized just like the past war criminals. 
					
					 Japan can neither gloss over the hideous crimes nor evade the responsibility for them. 
					
					 The primary political task to be carried out by Japan is to fulfill responsibility for the hideous crimes committed against humanity. It is nonsensical for Japan to discuss another problem except for this issue. 
					
					 These days Japan is recklessly joining in the U.S. "human rights" offensive against the DPRK in a bid to divert elsewhere the international community's criticism of it. This, however, will never help Japan get rid of its predicament. 
					
					 The flurry of rhetoric employed by crafty Japan to evade its responsibility for the past crimes would only touch off bitterer hatred of the international community towards Japan and this would precipitate its total ruin. 
					
					 Japan would be well advised to behave itself, properly understanding the essence of the situation.

articles.title: Koreans in Japan Observe Kim Jong Il's Demise Anniversary
articles.content:
Koreans in Japan Observe Kim Jong Il's Demise Anniversary
 Tokyo, December 15 (KNS-KCNA) -- A memorial service of Koreans in Japan was held at the Korean Hall of Culture in Tokyo on Dec. 13 on the occasion of the third anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il. 
					 Present there were Ho Jong Man, chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) and other officials of Chongryon, Korean compatriots and students of Korean University.
					
					 The participants observed a moment's silence in memory of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Ho Jong Man said in a memorial address that during the past three years Koreans in Japan keenly realized with each passing day how great the feats performed by Kim Jong Il all his life was.
					
					 He paid the highest tribute to Kim Jong Il in boundless reverence of all the officials of Chongryon and Koreans in Japan, wishing for his immortality, he said, adding: 
					
					 Kim Jong Il defended Chongryon and Koreans in Japan and led the movement of Koreans in Japan in the new century to victory till the last moments of his great life. Therefore, he is immortal in their minds as the defender of their destiny and tender-hearted father.
					
					 The respected Marshal Kim Jong Un is the genius of creation and construction who has achieved victory in the continuous confrontation with the U.S. and its followers with his brilliant wisdom, outstanding political ability and bold pluck and wisely led the building of a socialist economic power and a highly civilized nation, translating the people's dream and ideal into a bright reality in the homeland.
					
					 Ho Jong Man called on all the Koreans in Japan to glorify the revolutionary life of Kim Jong Il and the immortal feats he performed for the movement of Koreans in Japan and dynamically advance to develop the patriotic movement of Chongryon under the leadership of Kim Jong Un as required by the glorious era of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Speeches of representatives of different social standings were made at the meeting.
					
					 Memorial services took place at the Chongryon headquarters of Osaka, Hyogo, Aichi, Ibaraki, Hiroshima, Fukuoka, Hokkaido on the same day.

articles.title: Seminar Held by Korean Social Scientists in Japan
articles.content:
Seminar Held by Korean Social Scientists in Japan
 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- A seminar "Undying Feats and Great Succession" was held by Korean social scientists in Japan at the Korean Press Hall in Tokyo on Dec. 4 on the occasion of the third anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 It was attended by Han Tong Song, director of the Department for Publicity and Culture of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon), Ri Yong Su, chairman of the Korean Social Scientists Association in Japan, leading officials of organizations and enterprises of Chongryon, teachers of Korean University under Chongryon and Chongryon officials and other Koreans in Kanto area.
					
					 Speakers said that Kim Jong Il comprehensively developed in depth the Juche idea and the Songun idea founded by President Kim Il Sung and thus glorified them as the great guiding idea and indicated the way for accomplishing the popular masses' cause of independence.
					
					 They noted that he developed in depth the Juche-based idea of the movement of overseas compatriots and provided the movement of Koreans in Japan with a sure guarantee of winning victory after victory, advancing along the orbit of Juche.
					
					 He successfully settled the issue of the succession to the leadership, gave a steady continuity to the lineage of the revolutionary cause of Juche and Songun and created the history of the cause of perpetuating the memory of the leader, making sure that the revolutionary career and feats of Kim Il Sung shine for long, they said.
					
					 Marshal Kim Jong Un is working heart and soul for the country and the nation that were entrusted to him by Kim Jong Il, they pointed out.
					
					 They underlined the need to firmly defend and glorify the Songun revolutionary leadership feats of Kim Jong Il under the leadership of Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Application of Tuition-free Program to Korean Schools Demanded
articles.content:
Application of Tuition-free Program to Korean Schools Demanded
 Tokyo, December 15 (KNS-KCNA) -- Students of Korean University of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon) held a rally outside the building of the Japan Ministry of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology on Dec. 12 in demand of the application of tuition-free program for senior high schools to Korean schools.
					 It was attended by leading officials of organizations and enterprises of Chongryon, chairpersons of Chongryon headquarters in Kanto area, other Chongryon officials, Koreans in Japan, teachers and students of Korean University and Japanese personages.
					
					 Deploring that the Japanese authorities have excluded Korean schools from the tuition-free program for 4 years for a political reason, speakers termed it an unpardonable human rights abuse seriously encroaching upon the rights of Korean students.
					
					 They urged the authorities to apply the program to Korean schools as early as possible.
					
					 They declared they would stage actions against the Japanese government's ceaseless suppression of Chongryon and moves for stamping out Korean education.

articles.title: Int. Body Holds Memorial Events for Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Int. Body Holds Memorial Events for Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- The Organization of Solidarity of the Peoples of Africa, Asia and Latin America held a remembrance meeting, photo exhibition and film show on Dec. 10 on the occasion of the third anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Displayed at the venues of the events were photos showing his revolutionary career and exploits.
					
					 Korean film "Pyongyang Today" was shown.
					
					 Present at the events were members of the leadership of the organization and representatives of the political parties of different countries residing in Cuba.
					
					 Addressing the events, the secretary general of the organization said:
					
					 We again look back on the undying exploits of Kim Jong Il, eternal general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, on the occasion of the third anniversary of his demise.
					
					 He reliably defended the national sovereignty, carrying forward the cause of Comrade Kim Il Sung, founder of socialist Korea.
					
					 He was the greatest man who beat back the outrageous moves of the imperialists for invasion of the DPRK late in the last century at a time when socialism collapsed in some countries, and protected the dignity of the DPRK.
					
					 The progressive people all over the world pay highest tribute to him for his great contributions to the cause of global independence.

articles.title: Demise Anniversary of Kim Jong Il Observed in Japan
articles.content:
Demise Anniversary of Kim Jong Il Observed in Japan
 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- A memorial meeting took place in Japan on Dec. 11 to observe the third anniversary of demise of Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK).
					 Present there were Singo Kanemaru, chairman of the Japan committee for honoring the memory of General Secretary Kim Jong Il, Fumihiro Himori, chairman of the Japan Committee for Supporting the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea, Kenichi Ogami, secretary general of the International Institute of the Juche Idea, and personages of organizations for friendship and solidarity with the Korean people.
					
					 Present there on invitation were Nam Sung U, vice-chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan (Chongryon), and other Chongryon officials.
					
					 The participants observed a moment's silence in memory of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Speeches were made at the meeting.
					
					 Singo Kanemaru recollected with deep emotion that he was received by Kim Jong Il, praising his rare wisdom and humble and noble personality.
					
					 12 years have passed since the publication of the Japan-DPRK Pyongyang Declaration but progress has not been made in normalizing the relations between the two countries, he noted.
					
					 Touching on the talks between the governments of the two countries, he sincerely hoped that they would continue without suspension.
					
					 Personages of the organizations for friendship and solidarity with the Korean people said the DPRK changed beyond recognition for the past three years since the demise of Kim Jong Il, adding it is a brilliant fruition of the wise leadership of Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the WPK who has devoted himself to implementing the behests of the preceding leaders.
					
					 Noting that the adoption of the Japan-DPRK Pyongyang Declaration is a great exploit of Kim Jong Il, they evinced their will to intensify their activities for friendship between the two countries in the future.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Remembered in Different Countries
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Remembered in Different Countries
 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- Memorial meetings were held in Russia, Belarus and Uganda from Dec. 8 to 10 on the third anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Displayed at the venues of the events were works of the peerless great men of Mt. Paektu and books introducing Songun Korea. 
					
					 Present there were personages of a Russian university, the Belarus National Association of Friends of Korean People Named after Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, the Belarus Association for the Study of the Juche Idea and a command of the Defence Ministry of Uganda and masses.
					
					 They laid floral baskets before the portraits of smiling President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il before paying tribute to them.
					
					 The head of a department of the Russian university praised the revolutionary life and exploits of Kim Jong Il, saying that December 17 is the third anniversary of his demise.
					
					 The chairman of the Permanent Standing Committee of the Belarusian National Association of Friends of Korean People Named after Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il noted Kim Jong Il was the most outstanding great man who devoted his all to the well-being of the Korean people all his life.
					
					 The chairman of the Belarus Association for the Study of the Juche Idea said the Juche idea founded by Kim Il Sung and developed and enriched by Kim Jong Il was the guidelines for the progressive people across the world at the present time and in the future, too.
					
					 The commander of a command of the Defence Ministry of Uganda praised Kim Jong Il as the distinguished Songun brilliant commander who frustrated the hostile forces' moves to stifle the DPRK with his original Songun politics and protected the sovereignty of the country and the people.

articles.title: Korean Photo, Book and Handicrafts Exhibitions Open in Russia, Peru
articles.content:
Korean Photo, Book and Handicrafts Exhibitions Open in Russia, Peru
 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- Korean photo, book and handicrafts exhibitions opened at a museum of Russia and a cultural hall of Peru on Dec. 5 and 10 to observe the third anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 On display at the exhibition halls were photos showing the exploits of Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Also displayed there were works of the peerless great men of Mt. Paektu, books and photos introducing Songun Korea and handicrafts associated with the wisdom and talents of the Korean people.
					
					 A vice-mayor of Russia said:
					
					 The exhibition will help our citizens know better about the revolutionary career and exploits of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 They are remembering him as he performed great exploits for the development of the Russia-DPRK friendly relations by visiting the Siberian and Far East Regions of Russia during even the last moments of his life.
					
					 We will exert our efforts to further develop the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries. 
					
					 An official of a Peruvian city office said the exhibition would offer an opportunity for citizens to know better about the exploits of the great leaders of the DPRK and its heroic struggle for independence and prosperity and wisdom and talents of its people, wishing them bigger successes in their future struggle.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Russia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il to Be Remembered in Russia
 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- A committee for honoring the memory of leader Kim Jong Il was inaugurated by the Far Eastern Association for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism of Russia on Dec. 10.
					 Gennady Kulikov, chairman of the association, was elected chairman of the committee.
					
					 It decided to organize political and cultural events in praise of the revolutionary career and immortal feats of Kim Jong Il on the occasion of the 3rd anniversary of his demise.

articles.title: Foreigners Recollect Kim Jong Il's Exploits
articles.content:
Foreigners Recollect Kim Jong Il's Exploits
 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- Remembrance meetings were held in Finland, Iceland and Tanzania on Dec. 6 and 9 on the third anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 They laid bouquets and flowers before the portraits of smiling President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and paid tribute to them. 
					
					 The chairman and the international secretary of the Finnish Communists' League and the chairman of the Finland-Korea Society said Kim Jong Il enriched the Juche idea founded by Kim Il Sung to provide progressive humankind with the guidelines for their struggle for independence.
					
					 The general secretary of the Iceland-DPRK Friendship and Cultural Society praised Kim Jong Il as the great revolutionary and peerless patriot who dedicated his whole life to the prosperity of socialist Korea, the independent and peaceful reunification of Korea and the cause of global independence.
					
					 The secretary general of the Tanzania-DPRK Friendship Association and other speakers noted Kim Jong Il would be alive in the hearts of humankind forever, lauding his undying exploits for the Korean revolution and the human cause of independence.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Exploits Praised by Political Figures of India, Poland
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Exploits Praised by Political Figures of India, Poland
 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- Indian and Polish political figures made public statements on Dec. 10 and 11 on the 3rd anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Suneet Chopra, member of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of India (Marxist) and secretary general of the All India Indo-Korean Friendship Association, said: Comrade Kim Jong Il is the eternal general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and eternal chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK.
					
					 When the imperialists got more violent in their offensive against socialism in the late 20th century, he firmly defended the sovereignty and dignity of the country with his original Songun politics and turned socialist Korea into a politico-ideological power and military power.
					
					 His exploits for the times and revolution will shine forever.
					
					 Juzef Lachut, chairman of the Executive Committee of the Warsaw Regional Committee of the Polish Communist Party, said that Kim Jong Il regarded it as his motto to believe in the people as in Heaven, rallies all the people around the party with his politics of loving the people and achieved the single-minded unity of the whole society.

articles.title: British Organizations Observe Kim Jong Il's Demise Anniversary
articles.content:
British Organizations Observe Kim Jong Il's Demise Anniversary
 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy and the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea made public a joint statement on Dec. 8 on the occasion of the 3rd anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Reverence for Kim Jong Il is getting deeper with the approach of the anniversary of his demise, the statement said, adding:
					
					 His demise was the greatest loss not only to the Korean people who upheld and followed him as the tender-hearted father but to other progressives of the world.
					
					 He performed undying feats in all fields of state activities with his rare wisdom and outstanding leadership ability.
					
					 He developed the Workers' Party of Korea into the powerful vanguard ranks modeled on the idea of the leader, while foiling all the moves of hostile forces to check the triumphant advance of the revolutionary cause of Juche.
					
					 He authored famous works such as "Socialism Is a Science", instilling the conviction in victory of socialism into the world revolutionary people when the imperialists and renegades of socialism trumpeted about the "end of socialism".
					
					 The revolutionary cause of Juche started by President Kim Il Sung and led by Kim Jong Il is being successfully carried forward by Marshal Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Demise Observed by ForeignPapers
articles.content:
Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Demise Observed by ForeignPapers
 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- Malaysian and Mozambican papers carried special write-ups on the occasion of the 3rd anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 The Malaysian paper Guang Ming Daily on Dec. 6 devoted one whole page to an article titled "HE Kim Jong Il, the great leader of the Korean people, will always be with the Korean people and other world progressives" illustrated with a portrait of smiling Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Three years have passed since the Korean people lost Kim Jong Il, the father of the nation, so suddenly and so early on Dec. 17, 2011, the article said, and went on:
					
					 In this period the Korean people worked hard to translate the plan and desire of Kim Jong Il into reality.
					
					 He was, indeed, the great leader trusted and followed by the Korean people as their father.
					
					 He was the symbol of the victory of the Korean people and mainstay that helped them overcome all difficulties.
					
					 The Mozambican paper Noticias on Dec. 8 carried an article titled "3rd anniversary of demise of HE Kim Jong Il" illustrated with a portrait of smiling Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The paper said:
					
					 The Korean people are boundlessly revering Kim Jong Il.
					
					 They are holding him in high esteem as the eternal chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK.
					
					 The feats he performed for the Korean revolution will last forever.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Off Press in Russia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Off Press in Russia
 Pyongyang, December 16 (KCNA) -- Marshal Kim Jong Un's work "Let Us Step Up the Building of a Thriving Country by Applying Kim Jong Il's Patriotism" was brought out in pamphlet by the Liberal Democratic Party of Russia.
					 The work, published on July 26, Juche 101 (2012), deals with the essence of Kim Jong Il's patriotism and his noble career dedicated to the country and its people.
					
					 It clarifies the important matters arising in applying Kim Jong Il's patriotism.
					
					 A book releasing ceremony took place in Moscow on Dec. 10.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un visita Fabrica de Alimentos para Ninos de Pyongyang
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un visita Fabrica de Alimentos para Ninos de Pyongyang
Pyongyang, 16 de diciembre (ACNC) -- El Mariscal Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, visito la Fabrica de Alimentos para Ninos de Pyongyang.
					Viendo el mural de mosaicos con la imagen del Presidente Kim Il Sung y el monumento a la visita de orientacion del Dirigente Kim Jong Il, construidos en el recinto de la fabrica, el Mariscal recordo las hazanas del Dirigente,  quien dejo el 8 de julio de 2001 sus huellas de orientacion en esta fabrica.
					
					Dijo en tono emocionante que en este mundo no hay los lideres como nuestro Presidente y Dirigente quienes llamando a los ninos como reyes del pais, consideraban el amor por las generaciones venideras como labor mas importante del Partido y el Estado y dedicaron todos los suyos en todas sus vidas por los ninos.
					
					Propuso levantar nuevamente el mural de mosaicos con imagenes del Presidente y el Dirigente para que se transmitiera para siempre el amor por las generaciones venideras y el porvenir dejado por ellos en esta fabrica.
					
					Al recorrer la sala de presentacion del historial el Mariscal dijo que esa fabrica levantada por el Presidente, se ha convertido bajo la orientacion del Dirigente en una base combinada de produccion de los alimentos para ninos capaz de producir y suministrar normalmente la harina de leche para bebes, la nutritiva de arroz, la de verduras de diversos generos, la de laminaria, la de pescados y los demas alimentos para bebes de lactancia y  destete, la leche y kefir de soya propicios para el crecimiento de los ninos y alumnos.
					
					Encomendo educar bien a los funcionarios y empleados en las hazanas de direccion del Presidente y el Dirigente grabadas en la fabrica, para que normalicen en alto nivel la produccion, y transmiten sin cesar el amor a los ninos.
					
					En varios lugares de la fabrica, tales como la sala de exhibicion de productos, el taller de leche de soya, el de harina nutritiva de arroz y el de harina de leche para bebes, se entero en detalles del estado de produccion y gestion.
					
					No se debe parar ni un momento la produccion de la Fabrica de Alimentos para Ninos de Pyongyang, apunto y agrego que normalizar la produccion de la fabrica no es una simple labor economico-practica, sino una labor relacionada  de la obligacion moral a los Generalisimos.
					
					Las fuerzas hostiles se desesperan  por que no se oigan las risas de los ninos en nuestro pais, asevero y puntualizo que hay que producir mucho mas los alimentos para ninos y de esta manera demostrarles como defendemos las risas  de los ninos y el socialismo.
					
					Destaco la necesidad de desplegar activamente la labor por elevar en el maximo nivel la calidad de los productos y desarrollar nuevos alimentos necesarios al crecimiento de ninos comparandolos y analizandolos con los afamados alimentos nutritivos de ninos en el mundo con la ambicion de tomar hegemonia mundial en la produccion alimentaria.
					
					Exhorto a automatizar y esterilizar sin polvo todos los procesos de la produccion al aprender del ejemplo de las fabricas alimentarias del EPC, convertidas en modelos en el pais y ordeno  culminar la modernizacion de la fabrica hasta el dia del 70o aniversario de la fundacion del PTC (10 de octubre de 2015).
					
					El Mariscal se fotografio junto con los funcionarios y empleados de la fabrica.
					
					Le acompanaron el secretario del Comite Central del PTC, Choe Ryong Hae, el vicemariscal del EPC Hwang Pyong So, jefe de la Direccion Politica General del EPC, los jefes de departamento del CC del PTC, An Jong Su y Han Kwang Sang, el primer subjefe de departamento del CC del PTC, Ri Jae Il, y el subjefe de departamento del CC del PTC, Jo Yong Won.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam felicita al rey de Bahrein
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita al rey de Bahrein
Pyongyang, 16 de diciembre (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, remitio hoy un mensaje de felicitacion al rey de Bahrein, Hamad Bin Isa al-Khalifa, en ocasion del dia nacional de ese reino.
					En su misiva, el remitente manifesto la conviccion de que seguiran fortaleciendose y desarrollandose en lo adelante las relaciones de amistad entre los dos paises.
					
					Y deseo de todo corazon al pueblo de Bahrein el incesante progreso y prosperidad.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam felicita dia nacional de Kazajstan
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita dia nacional de Kazajstan
Pyongyang, 16 de diciembre (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 16 un mensaje de felicitacion al presidente de la Republica de Kazajstan, Nursultan Nazarbayev, con motivo del dia nacional de ese pais.
					Convencido de que seguiran ampliandose y desarrollandose las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion RPDC-Kazajstan conforme a los intereses y deseos comunes de los pueblos de dos paises, el remitente deseo exitos en los esfuerzos del destinatario y el pueblo de Kazajstan por lograr la unidad social y el desarrollo economico.

articles.title: Portavoz de MINREX condena campana de DDHH anti-RPDC de EE.UU.
articles.content:
Portavoz de MINREX condena campana de DDHH anti-RPDC de EE.UU.
Pyongyang, 16 de diciembre (ACNC) -- En exclusiva con la ACNC concedida el dia 15 con motivo de que se torna cada vez mas febril la campana de "derechos humanos" anti-Republica Popular Democratica de Corea de Estados Unidos, el portavoz del Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores de la RPDC dio la siguiente respuesta:
					En estos dias, se hace cada vez mas acalorada la ofensiva de EE.UU. contra la RPDC en el campo de derechos humanos.
					
					Solo durante la semana pasada, el secretario de Estado, el asistente del secretario para Asia Oriental y el Pacifico, el asistente del secretario para Democracia, Derechos Humanos y Trabajo, el "enviado especial de DDHH del Norte de Corea" y el representante especial de la politica sobre Corea del Departamento de Estado de Estados Unidos pronunciaron por turno las palabras que difaman a la RPDC cuestionando el "problema de DDHH".
					
					El Departamento de Estado hizo publica la pauta concreta para la ayuda financiera a las entidades de "DDHH" anti-RPDC mientras el Congreso norteamericano aprobo un "proyecto de ley" que empuja al administrador de la Agencia Estatal de Inteligencia y al secretario de Estado a espiar el interior de la RPDC y recoger los datos para la demagogia contra esta. Asi se dan sin escrupulos los movimientos para la escalada de la confrontacion con la RPDC en materia de DDHH.
					
					Esos movimientos demuestran que EE.UU. politiza e impulsa de manera planificada la campana de "DDHH" anti-RPDC tomandola como espacio para suprimir la ideologia y regimen de la segunda.
					
					Tal comportamiento significa el abandono de la Declaracion Conjunta del 19 de Septiembre aprobada en las conversaciones a seis bandas en que la RPDC y EE.UU. se comprometieron a respetar la soberania de la contraparte y convivir de manera pacifica.
					
					Dado que EE.UU. se enfrasca en derrocar el regimen de la RPDC valiendose de todos los medios y metodos, la desnuclearizacion de la Peninsula Coreana perdera por completo su significado.
					
					La RPDC se puso de acuerdo con la desnuclearizacion de la Peninsula Coreana no para ser ocupada por EE.UU. sino para eliminar la amenaza nuclear proveniente de este y garantizar la paz y seguridad de la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					Hoy dia cuando esta sobre el tapete el enfrentamiento de "DDHH" RPDC-EE.UU., carecera de sentido cualquier dialogo sobre el problema nuclear.
					
					EE.UU. dice unos chismes en cuanto a la excarcelacion de los norteamericanos retenidos en la RPDC. Pero, la RPDC libero a ellos no porque quiso el dialogo con EE.UU. sino como parte de la limpieza previa al enfrentamiento en la esfera de DDHH.
					
					En realidad, la RPDC tiene mucho mas que decir de los DDHH que EE.UU.
					
					Es Estados Unidos el que cayo en aprieto al conocerse en casa los datos de torturas antieticas hechas por la Agencia Central de Inteligencia y los escandalos de discriminacion racial de los policias blancos.
					
					Tambien son EE.UU. y sus satelites los que pasaron tremenda pena cuando fue desmentido su rumor manipulado sobre los jovenes y escolares norcoreanos que repatriaron luego de ser secuestrados por los traficantes de seres humanos.
					
					Recientemente, el secretario de Estado, Kerry, orquesto la payasada de elogiar publicamente a un "fugitivo norcoreano" estafador que lleva consigo para utilizarlo en la campana de "DDHH" anti-RPDC. Este hecho muestra que Kerry esta enloquecido por la campana hostil anti-RPDC.
					
					El ex secretario de Estado, Powell, se habia dejado llevar por los embustes de la CIA que recoge y manipula las informaciones mediante torturas, y su sucesor Kerry actua como tonto siendo enganado por un "fugitivo norcoreano".
					
					Por la via correspondiente, se ha enviado ya a Kerry el video que revela la forma de ser de aquel fugitivo estafador.
					
					El intento de EE.UU. de derrocar el regimen de la RPDC cuestionando el "problema de DDHH" no es una politica sino un delirio.
					
					EE.UU. probara la batalla de confrontacion de intransigente, nunca vista antes, que librara la RPDC frente a la politica hostil, y asumira la responsabilidad total del fracaso de la desnuclearizacion de la Peninsula Coreana.
